üí° What's Happening:

Welcome! The optimal approach avoids rotating one node at a time. Instead, we make the list circular temporarily, then find exactly where to "cut" to achieve k rotations in one operation. Click "Next" to begin!

üìê Position Calculation

new_tail_position = n - k - 1

üìú Optimal Algorithm (O(n) time, O(1) space):

function rotateRight(head, k) { // Step 1: Find length and tail length = 1; tail = head; while (tail.next) { tail = tail.next; length++; } // Step 2: Reduce k k = k % length; if (k === 0) return head; // Step 3: Make circular tail.next = head; // Connect tail to head! // Step 4: Find new tail (n - k - 1 steps) stepsToNewTail = length - k - 1; newTail = head; for (i = 0; i < stepsToNewTail; i++) newTail = newTail.next; // Step 5: Break circle newHead = newTail.next; newTail.next = null; return newHead; }
